issue.title: [Rust] Builds are broken by rustyline on nightly 2019-05-16+
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5360](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5360). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Rust builds are broken on nightly since 2019-05-16. Please see <https://github.com/kkawakam/rustyline/issues/217>

The issue might need to be fixed on the rustyline crate.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5360?focusedCommentId=16842310) by Chao Sun (csun):*
Can we temporarily use an old nightly version (e.g., nightly-2019-05-15) to unblock the CI? We can always switch back to the latest nightly later after the issue is fixed.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5360?focusedCommentId=16842359) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Let me know how you'd like to proceed – if there is no fix in the next few hours I'm going to move Rust to the "allow failures" section of Appveyor/Travis CI so PR/master builds don't appear to be failed

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5360?focusedCommentId=16842360) by Neville Dipale (nevi_me):*
The author and other contributors of the repo are on the line, I'm submitting a PR now, and will advise in the next 30 minutes if we've resolved this.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5360?focusedCommentId=16842368) by Neville Dipale (nevi_me):*
I've submitted a PR: <https://github.com/kkawakam/rustyline/pull/219>

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5360?focusedCommentId=16842563) by Chao Sun (csun):*
Issue resolved by pull request 4337
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4337>
